TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed beforefieldinit MsmqTransportBindingElement extends System.ServiceModel.Channels.MsmqBindingElementBase

remarks.para: The enables the user to set the properties of the queued communication channel. The queued communication channel uses Message Queuing for its transport.
This binding element is the default binding element used by the Message Queuing standard binding ().

summary.para: Represents the binding element used to specify the queuing communication properties for a indigo1 service that uses the native Message Queuing (MSMQ) protocol.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor() cil managed

summary.para: Initializes a new instance of the class.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig virtual instance class System.ServiceModel.Channels.IChannelFactory`1<!!TChannel> BuildChannelFactory<TChannel>(class System.ServiceModel.Channels.BindingContext context) cil managed

remarks.para: A channel factory is created and initialized using the properties that have been set in the binding element. The initialized channel factory is then used to create output channels that can be used to send messages to a message queue.

summary.para: Builds a channel factory using the context provided.

returns.para: A Message Queuing (MSMQ) channel factory that can be used to create channels to send messages to existing Message Queuing applications.

Docs.param: The with which to build the channel factory.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig virtual instance class System.ServiceModel.Channels.BindingElement Clone() cil managed

summary.para: Returns a clone of the binding element.

returns.para: A clone of the binding element.

remarks.para: The internal Message Queuing message object pool is used to avoid allocations of these objects when sending and receiving messages. The maximum pool size is a performance-tuning parameter. The default value is 8.

summary.para: Gets or sets an integer that specifies the maximum size of the pool that contains internal Message Queuing (MSMQ) message objects.

remarks.para: Message Queuing (MSMQ) does not support Active Directory addressing when using SOAP Reliable Messaging Protocol (SRMP), so do not set to or when is set to true.

summary.para: Gets or sets an enumeration value that indicates the queued communication channel transport that this binding uses.

remarks.para: The Message Queuing (MSMQ) queued transport supports several addressing schemes, including net.msmq.

summary.para: Returns a that contains the addressing scheme that is used by this transport binding element.

remarks.para: Message Queuing (MSMQ) queue addresses can consist of path names or direct format names. With a direct format name, MSMQ resolves the queue name using DNS, NetBIOS, or IP. With a path name, MSMQ resolves the queue name using Active Directory.

By default, the indigo1 queued transport converts the URI of a message queue to a direct format name. By setting the property to true, an application can specify that the queued transport should resolve the computer name using Active Directory rather than DNS, NetBIOS, or IP.

summary.para: Returns a Boolean value that indicates whether queue addresses should be converted using Active Directory.
